SOBMS IN ENGLISH - No* 8
Alfred, Lord Tennyson
thm EA0UT
He clasps the crag with crooked hands;
Close to the sun in lonely lands.
Bingâ€™d with the azure world,
he stands*
The wrinkled sea beneath him crawls;
He watches from his mountain walls.
And like a thunderbolt he falls*
I. A BRIEF BARAEBBA8E
An eagle, perched high upon a rocky cliff overlooking the sea, watches
for his prey, and then plunges down to seize it*
